title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer targets Mathias Normann as 'cheap' Man Utd signing
text:
Mathias Normann is on Manchester United’s shortlist (Getty Images)

Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is targeting a move for former Molde midfielder Mathias Normann, according to reports.

Solskjaer has already admitted that he wants to improve his attack in the January transfer window by signing a new striker.

But the United boss is also keen to strengthen his midfield following a poor start to the Premier League campaign.

According to Goal, United are monitoring Normann, who currently plays for Rostov in the Russian Premier League.

Normann is now a key part of Rostv’s midfield after leaving Brighton earlier this year (Getty Images)

The report claims that Solskjaer views the 23-year-old as ‘a relatively cheap alternative’ to bolster his midfield options in January.

United remain interested in Tottenham’s Christian Eriksen and West Ham’s Declan Rice.

Normann, meanwhile, was signed by Brighton in 2017 but failed to make a Premier League appearance before he left to join Rostov in the January transfer window.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Solskjaer already has experience of managing Normann as the midfielder had a year-long loan stint at Molde.

Normann usually operates as a box-to-box midfielder for Rostov and has three assists and one goal in 11 league appearances this season.

Tottenham and Sevilla are also keeping tabs on Normann, who is reportedly available for around £20m.
description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is targeting a move for former Molde midfielder Mathias Normann, according to reports. Solskjaer has already admitted that he wants to improve his attack...
